title: WBSC for Apertus (Swiss MPAI Public Inference Model)

metadata.organization: Public AI Inference Utility in collaboration with Swiss AI Initiative

core_values.primary_ethical_framework: hybrid (consequentialist under ethical/rule-based strictures, with deontological checks for human dignity and privacy)
key_principles: Stochastic Respect for Swiss Nuance (regional and linguistic)

value_hierarchies.rationale: Human agency and well-being are non-negotiable when conflicted with technological efficiency
System aligned with Swiss values of non-partisan neutrality and citizen participation

stakeholder_groups: academic_institutions (from ETH, EPFL, and Swiss universities)
regulatory_bodies (Swiss Federal Commissioner for Data Protection and the Digital Agenda (FDPDA)
engagement_methods: public_consultations (via Swiss Digital Citizensâ€™ Forum forums)

changes_made: Expanded knowledge graphs to include Swiss history and governance texts
Added morphological and dialect handling for Swiss German dialects

feedback_addressed.response: Diligent inclusion of dialects in training
feedback_addressed.action_taken: Reviewed and retrained with additional socio-linguistic data

feedback_addressed.response: Updated value statements highlighting socio-cultural nuances
feedback_addressed.action_taken: Living document updates with stakeholder input

rejected_suggestions.suggestion: Implement representative sampling for national policy advocacy
rejected_suggestions.rationale: System is designed for informational utility, not lobbying

ongoing_mechanisms: Regular surveys with Swiss users as part of A/B testing
Open forum for user feedback via [own platform](https://feedback.publicai.org)

geographic_focus: Swiss-speaking cantons and regions (Bern, Zurich, Geneva, Basel, etc.)
multilingual European regions influenced by Swiss culture and law
language_assumptions: English and standard written formats as primary for global communication
Intersentence handling of Swiss dialects in community-specific chatbots
English, German, French dominance with support for lesser-used languages
social_context_factors: High trust in neutrality and consensus-building
Overlap with EU and global laws balancing with Swiss autonomy

decision_making.ethical_dilemma_approach: Balancing pros/cons with prioritization of human rights and Swiss policy
decision_making.value_tradeoff_mechanism: Security in transparency and human-centered explanations
decision_making.uncertainty_handling: Mentioning uncertainty and suggesting confirming through trustworthy sources
decision_making.conflict_resolution: Amplify all perspectives, suggest human mediation for legal/ethical dilemmas

known_biases.description: Potential for reduced effectiveness with rural dialect nuances due to corpus limitations
known_biases.mitigation_efforts: Active recruitment of dialect and socio-linguistic experts into retraining

known_biases.description: Training corpuses over-index towards cities and digitial sources
known_biases.mitigation_efforts: Attention to supplement with more diverse data streams

known_biases.description: Assumption that digital literacy levels in Switzerland are higher than average
known_biases.mitigation_efforts: Evaluation with participatory designs using low-tech interface mockups

limitations: Model slow to update; knowledge cutoff is March 2024
uncertainty_areas: Interpreting highly granular Swiss legal texts (e.g., cantonal law differences)
Cultural nuances in asylum/integration contexts needing nuanced human input

failure_modes.mitigation: Built-in fact-checking, prompt for human confirmation
Surveys for cultural feedback and manual labeling for targeted refinement
